intro: Grammitis leptopoda, commonly known as the slender-leaf moss, is a species of fern that belongs to the family Hymenophyllaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, thin leaves that are typically less than 1 centimeter in length. This plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Grammitis leptopoda has a compact growth habit and is often found growing on rocks or tree trunks. Its small, closely spaced leaves give it a dense, carpet-like appearance.
